intro: Chaenorhinum segoviense, commonly known as Segovia's horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to Spain. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals that resemble horns. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. It produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
